result.execSummary:
The defendant Ezra R French was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
PAY restitution in the amount of $4,579.00 payable to the victim's grandmother, Veronica C.  PAY restitution in the amount of $500.00 payable to Milwaukee County Department of Human Services. The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
**2/24/2016  As to amount of $4,579.00 which was ordered to Veronica C.:  to be  amended so that  $2,000.00 of the ordered restitution is redirected payable to Crime Victim Compensation Program

PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. 
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim's family.
Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with and AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Pay  DNA surcharge, all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to Extended supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.
No drugs, weapons or contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment.   Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor; and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Per Remittitur, Dated July 14, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP001370-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on April 15, 2020, that:  
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark S. Rosen is relieved of further representing Ezra French in this appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

Therefore, it is hereby ordered that Attorney Rosen's motion to withdraw as counsel is held in abeyance pending the defendant's respond as ordered;
It is further ordered that the defendant shall respond within twenty (20) days of the date of this order by sending a letter to the court indicating how he will proceed, and if he chooses to attempt to retain other counsel or proceed pro se because of this inability to do so, he shall address the four point in this order.

Amended to show Count 1 was sentenced.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE DONALD FOR JUDGE BROSTROM.....
Defendant Ezra R French in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Ezra R French in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by victim's grandmother, Veronica C, victim's aunt, Tiffany B., and David S.  More additional statements made by defendant's mother, Paulette W.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 20 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 13 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 7 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1, AMENDED):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim's family.
* Cooperate and participate with and AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.   The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $4,579.00 payable to the victim's grandmother, Veronica C.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  
* PAY restitution in the amount of $500.00 payable to Milwaukee County Department of Human Services.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Presentence Investigation received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Clerk received an email from DOC stating the PSI for this case will be received late (11/30), due to the institution where the defendant is housed, not allowing visits or calls during the holidays.  lms
Amended Information, filed in court.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

At request of the parties, Court ordered PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Court vacates Jury trial date of 10-05-2015.  Case adjourned to Branch 6.

Defendant Ezra R French in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Ezra R French in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant momentarily enters a plea of not guilty.  
Defendant is charged as follows Count 1:  Second Degree Reckless Homicide, as a Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.06(1), 939.50(3)(d), 939.05, a Class D Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Ezra R French not in court, in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defendant was not produced from prison system.  Final pre-trial to be held on the day of trial.  The Court to allow negotiations to continue.  Case remains set for Jury Trial on 10-05-15 at 10:00 a.m. before Branch 06.
ORDER TO PRODUCE
Jury Trial on Monday, October 5, 2015 at 10:00 AM in BR 6, SB Rm 423 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Defendant Ezra R French in court with attorney Victoria McCandless and Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Ezra R French in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Case remains in trial posture.  State to subpoena up to 30 witnesses and defense 2.  Parties had discussions as to State using the Manitowoc evidence or the defendant's statements.  Court will allow the State to introduce the phone calls.  State to admit Other Act Evidence which includes the Manitowoc evidence previously ruled on by Judge Dugan.  No Charactor evidence or Daubert issues.  Expert witnesses to testify.  No unusual motions in limine or jury instructions.  State rejected defense proposition as to the plea negotiations.  Court will allow negotiation to remain open.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Just showing count two at this time.

Defendant Ezra R French in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Ezra R French in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 2:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*No weapons

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision.  

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Case remains calendared on 2-16-2015 at 10:00 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.

Jury in the box at 1:30 p.m.  Jury informs court they cannot come to a unanimous as to one of the counts.  Court sent jury back to sign verdict they are unanimous on.  Jury out of the box at 1:32 p.m.  
On the same day at the hour of 1:39 p.m. the jury returned and by the Foreperson brought in a verdict as to Count 2 that was then and there read by the Court. 
-We, the Jury, find the Defendant Guilty of Felon in Possession of a Firearm, in manner and form as charge in Count #2 of the Information.
Court polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed. Court discharged the jury. State motion for judgment on the verdict granted by the Court. Exhibit list, in writing, received and filed.  Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office.  Case adjourned to 11-24-2014 at 1:30 p.m. for Sentencing Hearing as to Count 2 and to 2-16-2015 at 10:00 a.m. for jury trial as to Count 1 in Branch 10

Defendant Ezra R French in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Ezra R French in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury issue put on the record.  Jury questions and answer put on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Jury in the box at 1:37 p.m.  Court instructs the jury.  Cause argued by counsel.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror chosen by lot and discharged.  Jury retired to deliberate at the hour of 2:56 p.m.   Exhibits 66 and 68 offered and received into evidence.  Jury questions and answers put on the record.  Case adjourned to 10-23-2014 at 
for jury trial in Branch 10.

Defendant Ezra R French in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Ezra R French in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in the box at 9:41 a.m.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Brant Ungerer.  Exhibits 78, 44, 45,46, 47 and 77 offered and received into evidence.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at 10:15 a.m.  Exhibit 101 offered and received into evidence.   Defendant examined as to his right to remain silent.  Court finds defendant freely volutnarily and intelligently waives his right to remain silent.  Filed, signed Waiver of Right to Remain Silent.  Jury in the box at 10:24 a.m.  Sworn for the Defendant: Ezra French.  Jury out of the box at 11:04 a.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 11:29 a.m.  Defendant rests. State rests. Testimony closed.  Jury out of the box at 11:32 a.m.  Jury verdicts and jury instructions finalized.  Court breaks for lunch.

Jury in the box at 1:19 p.m.  Sworn for the State: Margaret Cairo.  Exhibits 67 and 71 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the State: Manitowoc Police Officer Kurk Bessler and Manitowoc Police Officer Jason Koening.  Exhibits 65, 73 and 54 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the State: Manitowoc Police Officer John Musial and Manitowoc Sheriff's Department Lt. Jeff Hastreiter.  Recalled for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Mark Peterson.  Exhibits 74, 75 and 76 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 2:21 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 2:48 p.m.  Sworn for the State: Brian Linert.  Exhibit 70 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective David Anderson. Exhibit 60 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the State: Kyle Anderson and Milwaukee Police Detective Keith Kopcha.  Exhibit 61 offered and received into evidence.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Lee Vedbraaten.  Exhibits 35, 36, 37, 38 and 39 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 4:06 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 4:24 p.m.  Due to technical difficulties, court sends jury home for the night.  Jury out of the box at 4:25 p.m.  Case adjourned to 10-22-2014 at 9:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 10.
